meanings.definition: The action of habituating or the state of being habituated.
meanings.sent1: Her daily habituations to exercise helped her stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: The habituations of waking up early became easier over time.
meanings.sent3: His habituations to eating ice cream for breakfast always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The habituations of a busy city can overwhelm newcomers.
meanings.sent5: The habituations of practicing piano every day made her a skilled musician.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to a certain behavior or routine.
meanings.sent1: The habituations to his new job took some time to adjust to.
meanings.sent2: Overcoming bad habituations can lead to positive changes in life.
meanings.sent3: Their habituations to always wearing matching outfits amused their classmates.
meanings.sent4: The habituations of a strict diet felt like a prison to her.
meanings.sent5: The habituations of daily meditation brought peace to his mind.
